page.title: 14Kinewell Lake.
page.content: Kinewell Lake got its name from a well which used to be in this field near the river.It was used by cattle so kine the old word for cattle was put with well to make Kinewell. The older people in the village were sad when it was excavated because they had always been able to walk along a beautiful foot path to the river so the company doing the work were asked if the village could have the lake.When it was finished this was agreed. The lake is now a bird reserve with five islands and has been planted with over 1000 trees.Some fish got into the lake when the river flooded, but soon it will be properly stocked so that village people can go fishing.
